questions.question: What is cache memory?
options: A brand of smartphones that have more memory than usual
A slower memory used to hold big files that can't fit in RAM
A persistent storage like an HD or SSD
A backup memory that stores data when the computer is turned off
A smaller memory to hold temporary values from RAM that are used frequently

options: A famous hacker known for breaking into government systems and creating the WikiLeaks website
A pioneer in the development of the internet, inventor of the http protocol
The inventor of the first mechanical computer
A computer scientist known for laying the groundwork for modern computing
A baron of scotland, inventor of the writing machine that later was the base to the creation of keyboards

To go back to a previous command
To send a value back to the caller of the function

questions.question: What is a 'syscall'?
options: A type of malware that infects system files by calling them multiple times
A system used to make calls using a SIM card
A software to call system administrators for help
A network protocol for making secure calls between systems
A system call that allows programs to request services from the operating system

Providing a platform for legal music downloads

questions.question: In cybersecurity, what does the term 'phishing' refer to?
options: A technique used to catch fish using electronic devices
A method of encrypting data for secure transmission
A cyber attack that tricks individuals into providing sensitive information
A software that protects against malware, catching them like fish in a net
